description: From Ancient Greek δεσποτικός (despotikós) via French despotique.

adjectives.description: despotic (comparative more despotic, superlative most despotic)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to a despot or tyrant.
examples: This despotic age of the empire ended in a revolt.

entries.meaning: Acting or ruling as a despot, tyrannical.
examples: The despotic king dissolved the parliament, and took personal control of the country.
